segments.text: Oh, and I can also speak a little French. Voulez-vous coucher avec moi ce soir?  Why? What did I say?
segments.speaker: Monica

segments.text: Well, you just asked if I wanted to go to bed with you tonight.
segments.speaker: Mischa

segments.text: Oh my God! No wonder I get such great service at Cafe Maurice.
segments.speaker: Monica

segments.text: Knock, knock, knock, knock, hi.
segments.speaker: Phoebe

segments.text: Um, could you please tell Sergei that um, I was fascinated by what Boutros Boutros Gali said in the New York Times.
segments.speaker: Phoebe

segments.text: You didn't say Boutros Boutros Gali.
segments.speaker: Phoebe

segments.text: Boutros Boutros Gali.
segments.speaker: Mischa

segments.text: He says he was too.
segments.speaker: Mischa

segments.text: Interesting.
segments.speaker: Phoebe

segments.text: So I was wondering....
segments.speaker: Mischa

segments.text: Okay, ah, before you get all talky again, umm, could you also please tell Sergei that I really like his suit.
segments.speaker: Phoebe

segments.text: Eh, he said, thank you very much, he thinks you look very pretty tonight, your hair, golden like the sun.
segments.speaker: Mischa

segments.text: So you're a chef?
segments.speaker: Mischa

segments.text: I'm also thinking about opening up my own restaurant.
segments.speaker: Monica

segments.text: Oh, really.
segments.speaker: Mischa

segments.text: Monica, can I talk to you behind my menu, please.  What are you doing?
segments.speaker: Phoebe

segments.text: Well, I was having a conversation.
segments.speaker: Monica

segments.text: Yeah but, Mischa is so interested in you, that Sergei and I haven't been able to say two words to each other.
segments.speaker: Phoebe

segments.text: What do you want me to do? Just sit here silently while you three have a conversation?
segments.speaker: Monica

segments.text: That would be great. Thank you.
segments.speaker: Phoebe
